intro: Tetragonia moorei, commonly known as the Moore's tetraheron, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its small, four-angled stems and fleshy leaves help it store water, making it well-suited for harsh climates. Tetragonia moorei is often found in coastal and sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
